titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Memorabilia FA1077

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-12-01 00:00:07 -0500.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Memorabilia
did.physdesc:
2 boxes, 2 packages and additional individual items.
Size of box 2: 4 x 4 x 12 Size of package: 18 x 22 x 2 1/2.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimal Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains as received, in original folders and storage cartons/packages.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research will select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.
All inquiries to view memorabilia require advanced notice of at least 48 business hours, and may necessitate notice of up to one week.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Box 2: Received from the office of the Business Manager, 1980 April. Package 1: Received from the office of the Business Manager, 1977 May.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Over the years since the founding of the Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research (RIMR) various ephemera, citations of appreciation, medals of commemoration, documents of greeting, and other forms of recognition have been received. A varied assortment has been assembled and arranged together.

did.unittitle: Celebration program of City College of the City of New York

did.unittitle: Louis Schmidt etchings

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: 11 pieces in the master set pulled from the original plates, 1968 July. Some prints were made and the plates were then destroyed. In this set there are an additional 4 prints collected from various places.

did.unittitle: Building plans

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In the 1970s, a suggestion was made to acquire air rights over the East River Drive for the purpose of some building expansion to be developed jointly with the neighboring medical institutions. The air rights were finally granted but final decisions to utilize them were abandoned.

However at one point consulting engineers and landscape architects, Clarke adn Rapuano presented plans for utilizing present land areas for additional buildings. The drawings were mounted and presented for consideration to the Board of Trustees.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Due to the nature and potentially brittle condition of this material, special arrangements may be required in order to view materials. Individual items may be restricted due to preservation concerns.
